sub_title: Space Biology Project Scientist working for the European Space Agency
summary:
In my career, I have been managing large biological data sets and performing statistical analysis on several omics datasets, including whole-genome and RNA-sequencing data.

I enjoy working with multi-disciplinary teams and helping build new bridges between different
fields. During my career, I have been working closely with scientists from different fields
to develop new methodologies to analyse and interpret complex biological data.

In over 10 years in the field of Biology and Omics, I have (co)-authored several papers and supervised data science projects.

Currently, I am working for the European Space Agency, to cover the scientific coordination of SciSpacE research in Biology on all mission platforms, such as ground-based facilities, drop towers, parabolic flights, sounding rockets, orbital robotics capsules, and the International Space Station.
